long_form.description: The perovskite composition according to IUPAC recommendations, where standard abbreviations are used for all ions. A-ions are listed in alphabetic order, followed by the B-ions in alphabetics order, followed by the X-ions in alphabetic order, all with their stochiometric coefficients. For increased clarity, we recommend enclosing all ions whose abbreviations are 3 letters or longer in parentheses.

short_form.description: The long_form stripped of the numeric coefficients. This is a useful key for searching and grouping perovskite data.

composition_estimate.description: A categorical description of how the composition is estimated. Standard options include: “Estimated from precursor solutions”, “Literature value”, “Estimated from XRD data”, “Estimated from spectroscopic data”, and “Theoretical simulation”.

sample_type.description: A categorical description of the type of sample the data describes. Standard options include: “Polycrystalline film”, “Single crystal”, “Quantum dots”, “Nano rods”, and “Colloidal solution”.

dimensionality.description: A categorical description of the dimensionality of the perovskite. Standard options include: “0D”, “1D”, “2D”, “3D”, “2D/3D”. “2D/3D” refers to a situation where a 2D phase is intermixed with a 3D phase but where the overall composition is given by the value in long_form.

bandgap.description: The band gap of the perovskite expressed in electron volt. Details of how the band gap is estimated is suggested to be encapsulated in a separate data schema.

a_ions.description: A list of dictionaries on the form [{key_1: value_1, key_2: value_2, …}, {key_1: value_1,  …}, …]. Each element in the list represents one A-site ion in the perovskite structure. Each ion is given its own dictionary with the keys listed below.

additives_and_impurities.description: A list of dictionaries on the form: [{key_1: value_1, key_2: value_2, …}, {key_1: value_1,  …}, …]. Each element in the list represents a dictionary with one component that is present in the film but not incorporated into the perovskite crystal structure. Keywords in the dictionaries include: the concentration, the function in the film, i.e. if it is to be considered as a secondary phase, an additive, a dopant or an impurity, and data to uniquely identify the compound including the same key value pairs found in the sections for perovskite ions.

function.description: The function of the additive or impurity in the film.

abbreviation.description: The abbreviation used for the additive or impurity.

concentration.description: The concentration of the additive or impurity.

concentration_metric.description: The metric used for the concentration of the additive or impurity.

molecular_formula.description: The Molecular formula which indicates the numbers of each type of atom in a molecule, with no information about the structure.

smile.description: The canonical SMILE string of the additive or impurity.

common_name.description: The common or trivial name of the additive or impurity.

iupac_name.description: The preferred systematic IUPAC name of the additive or impurity.

cas_number.description: The CAS number for the additive or impurity.
